Question: Which side of Africa is the Indian Ocean on?

Choices:
A: earth
B: west
C: asia
D: east
E: southern hemisphere
steps: Identify the location of the Indian Ocean in relation to Africa.
The Indian Ocean is one of the five major oceans on Earth.
Determine the position of Africa in relation to the Indian Ocean.
Africa is bordered by the Indian Ocean on its eastern side.
Now, consider the options given to see which one points to the east.
Option A: earth – not relevant, as it pertains to the planet as a whole.
Option B: west – this is opposite of the eastern side.
Option C: asia – while Asia is adjacent to the Indian Ocean, it does not pertain to Africa's location.
Option D: east – this is directly indicating the eastern side of Africa where the Indian Ocean is located.
Option E: southern hemisphere – this is too broad, as it includes areas not specifically related to the Indian Ocean’s position.
